qas.question: Why were popular paints and pigments in the nineteenth century highly toxic?
What color is most associated with toxicity and poison?

plausible_answers.text: several popular paints and pigments, notably verdigris, vert de Schweinfurt and vert de Paris, were highly toxic

qas.question: Why do Europeans associate green with health?
What was another name for Schweinfurt?
The Green Fairy was the name for what notable pigment?

context: Like other common colors, <a2_0>green<a2_0/> has several completely opposite associations. While it is the color most associated by Europeans and Americans with good health, it is also the color most often associated with toxicity and poison. There was a solid foundation for this association; in the nineteenth century <b3_0>several popular paints and pigments, notably <b6_0>verdigris<b6_0/>, vert de Schweinfurt and vert de Paris, were highly toxic<b3_0/>, containing <a1_0><b5_0>copper or arsenic<b5_0/><a1_0/>.[d] The intoxicating drink absinthe was known as "<a0_0><b4_0>the green fairy<b4_0/><a0_0/>".
